Package javelin.model.unit.feat

Class Feat

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.unit.feat.Feat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Acrobatic, Alertness, BullRush, Cleave, CombatCasting, Deceitful, ExoticWeaponProficiency, ExpertiseFeat, GreatCleave, ImprovedInitiative, ImprovedPreciseShot, MartialTraining, Multiattack, MultiweaponFighting, PointBlankShot, PowerAttack, PreciseShot, RapidShot, SaveFeat, Toughness, WeaponFinesse, WeaponFocus
    public abstract class Feat
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, Cloneable
    See the d20 SRD for more info. Would be nice to have Feat be a subclass of Upgrade, like Spell?
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      boolean arena  
      java.lang.String name
      Feat name as per d20 rules.
      Feat prerequisite
      If not null, symbolizes a previous requirement before acquiring this feat.
      boolean stack  
      boolean update
      If a feat needs updating, every time a Combatant is upgraded remove(Combatant) and add(Combatant) will be called so that there is a chance to update any statistics.

      • remove

        public void remove​(Combatant c)
        Called as part of the update flow.

      • add

        public boolean add​(Combatant c)
        This will be called when a Monster is being made into a Combatant. It is also called after upgrades when the update flag is set. Can be called multiple times if a monster has more than one feat of the same type as allowed by stack. Note that many feats do not have to implement this as the stat block itself will have the changes pre-computated in it. For example: Toughness and ImprovedInitiative only need to implement upgrade(Combatant).
        Returns:
        true in case of success.
